text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

WHEAT, BARLEY SALE - The Japanese Food Agency on Thursday bought 60,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat, 20,000 of Canadian wheat, 40,000 of Australian wheat, 20,000 of U.S. barley and 40,000 of Australian barley for March shipment, the agency said

- Morocco bought a total of 40,000 tonnes of French soft wheat for Feb 5-15 delivery under a Coface export credit. Morocco bought 20,000 tonnes of French wheat at $172.49 per tonne, and 20,000 at $165 per tonne, including freight and Coface, traders said.

WHEAT SALE - Algeria bought a total of 150,000 tonnes of soft wheat -- 125,000 from the French market under an export-guaranteed credit and 25,000 optional -- for delivery between February 25 and the first half of March, an Algerian official said on Thursday.

- Yemen bought 200,000 tonnes of European Union soft wheat flour and 200,000 tonnes of optional white wheat on Thursday. Yemen bought the wheat at $171 C and F per tonne, traders said. Shipment is for between June and August and the wheat is likely to come from the United States or Australia, they said.

WHEAT TENDERS - Armenia is seeking about 65,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat under the PL 480 program for January 23-February 6 delivery, its U.S. export agent said. Offers are to be submitted on January 15 and will be valid until January 16.
Lebanon's economy ministry plans to buy 50,000 tonnes of U.S. hard wheat later this month, the government said.

- Bangladesh seeks 100,000 tonnes of U.S. No.2 wheat or Australian standard or better Canadian winter red/spring wheat for shipment by February 21. Offers are to be opened January 18 and results announced two to three days later.

BARLEY TENDER - The Cyprus Grain Commission has invited tenders for the supply of one cargo of 25,000 tonnes of feed barley, with the tender closing January 17 and shipment between January 22 and February 5.
CORN TENDER - South Africa's Maize Board said on Monday it would offer by a tender 15,000 tonnes of yellow maize for either export or domestic use. The offer would close Jan 16.

CORN AND SOYBEAN TENDER - Taiwan's CK group passed on a tender Thursday for a combined shipment of 54,000 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 corn and soybeans due to high offer prices, traders said. No retender scedule was set.

CORN-SOYBEAN TENDER - Taiwan's Hui Shung Group will tender Friday for a combined shipment of 38,500 tonnes of U.S. soybeans and 16,000 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 corn. Shipment is from the U.S. Gulf for February 20 to March 6 or from the Pacific Northwest for March 7 to March 21.

VEGETABLE OIL TENDER CANCELLED - Egypt bought 10,000 tonnes of tallow at $530 and $583 per tonne C and F for delivery in the second half of March, a government official said. The company cancelled two other tenders for 20,000 tonnes of palm oil and palm stearin because the prices offered were too expensive.
RICE TENDER - Syria's General Foreign Trade Organization for Chemicals and Foodstuffs is seeking to buy 12,000 tonnes of white rice for March shipment. Results would be February 13.
MARKET TALK - Soybean and meal arrivals in China remained heavy but Chinese buyers were not making new deals as international prices floated above reach, traders said Thursday.
Current high corn prices are causing nervous sellers to wonder when the bullish trend will reverse, while the prospects for Chinese exports are still dim, grain sources said Thursday.
